articles.headline: Vast Expansion in Aid Kept Food Insecurity From Growing Last Year
articles.snippet: Despite the economic downturn, government figures for 2020 show no overall rise in hunger of the sort typical in past recessions. But some groups still suffered.
articles.abstract: Despite the economic downturn, government figures for 2020 show no overall rise in hunger of the sort typical in past recessions. But some groups still suffered.
articles.lead_paragraph: As 20 million jobs vanished at the start of the coronavirus pandemic and traffic jams formed outside food banks, many experts warned that the twin crises of unemployment and disease would produce soaring rates of hunger.

articles.headline: Skilled Workers Are Scarce, Posing a Challenge for Biden’s Infrastructure Plan
articles.snippet: One estimate says the bill would add $1.4 trillion to the U.S. economy over eight years, but without enough workers, efforts to strengthen roads and public transit could be set back.
articles.abstract: One estimate says the bill would add $1.4 trillion to the U.S. economy over eight years, but without enough workers, efforts to strengthen roads and public transit could be set back.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The infrastructure bill that President Biden hopes to get through Congress is supposed to create jobs and spur projects for companies like Anchor Construction, which specializes in repairing aging bridges and roadways in the nation’s capital.

articles.headline: A.I. Can Now Write Its Own Computer Code. That’s Good News for Humans.
articles.snippet: A new technology called Codex generates programs in 12 coding languages and even translates between them. But it is not a threat to professional programmers.
articles.abstract: A new technology called Codex generates programs in 12 coding languages and even translates between them. But it is not a threat to professional programmers.
articles.lead_paragraph: As soon as Tom Smith got his hands on Codex — a new artificial intelligence technology that writes its own computer programs — he gave it a job interview.

articles.headline: ‘Reversing Gears’: China Increasingly Rejects English, and the World
articles.snippet: A movement against Western influence threatens to close off a nation that succeeded in part by welcoming new ideas.
articles.abstract: A movement against Western influence threatens to close off a nation that succeeded in part by welcoming new ideas.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a student at Peking University law school in 1978, Li Keqiang kept both pockets of his jacket stuffed with handwritten paper slips. An English word was written on one side, a former classmate recalled, and the matching Chinese version was written on the other.

articles.headline: Inside Missouri’s ‘2nd Amendment Sanctuary’ Fight
articles.snippet: A new law puts Missouri at the vanguard of states challenging federal authority on guns. It began as a backlash, and it has set off another.
articles.abstract: A new law puts Missouri at the vanguard of states challenging federal authority on guns. It began as a backlash, and it has set off another.
articles.lead_paragraph: OZARK, Mo. — Brad Cole is a fiery defender of the Second Amendment, a set-jawed lawman with a lacquered alligator head on his desk, a Smith & Wesson .357 Magnum on his hip and a signed picture of himself with former President Donald J. Trump on his office wall.

articles.headline: Biden withdraws his nomination of David Chipman to lead the A.T.F.
articles.snippet: The defeat is a major setback to the president’s plan to reduce gun violence, and it comes after his push to expand background checks on gun purchases stalled in Congress.
articles.abstract: The defeat is a major setback to the president’s plan to reduce gun violence, and it comes after his push to expand background checks on gun purchases stalled in Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Biden nominated David Chipman to run the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives in March, he described it as an important step toward ending the “embarrassment” and “epidemic” of gun violence in America.

articles.headline: Smart Glasses Made Google Look Dumb. Now Facebook Is Giving Them a Try.
articles.snippet: The company has teamed up with Ray-Ban to create glasses that can take photos, record video, answer phone calls and play podcasts.
articles.abstract: The company has teamed up with Ray-Ban to create glasses that can take photos, record video, answer phone calls and play podcasts.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Last Saturday, after a three-mile hike through the Presidio, I stood in a throng of tourists looking at the Golden Gate Bridge. As the crowd snapped photos of the landmark, I decided to join in.
